name: Easter Lily
description: A fragrant white trumpet-shaped flower associated with spring religious celebrations. Native to Japan; forced into bloom commercially; symbol of purity and renewal.

name: Shasta Daisy
description: A cultivated perennial with classic white petals and yellow center. Hybrid created by Luther Burbank; cheerful garden flower; cut flower with long vase life.

name: Bread Wheat
description: A grass species providing the world's most important staple grain. Domesticated approximately 10,000 years ago; contains gluten for bread-making; grown on every continent except Antarctica.

name: Asian Rice
description: A semi-aquatic grass species feeding half the world's population. Grown in flooded paddies; dozens of thousands of varieties; central to Asian cultures and cuisines.

name: Maize
description: A grain crop domesticated in Mexico, now grown globally. Tall grass with ears of kernels; used for food, feed, and ethanol; central to Mesoamerican civilization.

name: Barley
description: An ancient cereal grain used for food, animal feed, and malting. Hardy and adaptable; one of first domesticated crops; essential ingredient in beer production.

name: Soybean
description: A legume native to East Asia, source of protein, oil, and animal feed. Nitrogen-fixing crop improving soil; processed into tofu, tempeh, and milk alternatives; major global commodity.

name: Cotton Plant
description: A shrubby plant producing fiber-covered seeds used for textiles. Native to tropical regions; historically linked to slavery; major agricultural commodity and water-intensive crop.

name: Giant Bamboo
description: A fast-growing woody grass reaching 30 meters in height. Strongest natural material relative to weight; used for construction, food, and crafts; spreads aggressively.

name: Giant Kelp
description: A large brown algae forming underwater forests in cold, nutrient-rich waters. Can grow 60 centimeters per day; provides habitat for diverse marine life; harvested for alginates.

name: Reindeer Lichen
description: A fruticose lichen forming extensive mats in arctic and boreal regions. Important winter food for caribou and reindeer; extremely slow-growing; sensitive to air pollution.

name: Escherichia Coli
description: A rod-shaped bacterium normally inhabiting animal intestines. Most strains beneficial for digestion; some cause serious illness; workhorse organism for genetic research.

name: SARS-CoV-2
description: A coronavirus causing COVID-19 respiratory disease. Emerged in late 2019; spreads through respiratory droplets; caused global pandemic with massive health and economic impacts.

name: Penicillium Fungus
description: A mold genus including species producing penicillin antibiotic. Blue-green spores; grows on decaying organic matter; revolutionized medicine when discovered.

name: Baker's Yeast
description: A single-celled fungus used for fermentation in baking and brewing. Converts sugars to carbon dioxide and alcohol; one of oldest domesticated organisms; important research model.

name: Black Bread Mold
description: A fast-growing fungus appearing on stale bread and decaying matter. Dark sporangia on white filaments; important decomposer; used in industrial organic acid production.

name: Zooplankton
description: Microscopic animals drifting in aquatic environments. Base of marine and freshwater food webs; includes larvae of larger animals; affected by ocean acidification.

name: Amoeba Proteus
description: A single-celled organism that moves and feeds using temporary projections. Shape-shifting predator of bacteria and algae; classic microscopy subject; reproduces by binary fission.

name: Toxoplasma Gondii
description: A parasitic protozoan completing life cycle in cats but infecting most warm-blooded animals. Linked to behavioral changes in infected hosts; common human infection, usually asymptomatic.

name: Prion
description: A misfolded protein that causes other proteins to misfold, creating fatal neurodegenerative diseases. Not technically living; causes diseases like BSE and CJD; extremely resistant to destruction.

name: Human Head
description: The uppermost part of the human body containing the brain and primary sense organs. Houses face for expression and communication; supported by neck; protected by skull.

name: Cerebral Cortex
description: The outer layer of the brain's cerebrum responsible for higher cognitive functions. Folded gray matter containing billions of neurons; processes language, reasoning, and consciousness.

name: Human Eye
description: A spherical sensory organ detecting light and enabling vision. Contains lens, retina, and optic nerve; color perception varies individually; culturally significant as "window to the soul."

name: Human Ear
description: A sensory organ for hearing and balance. Includes outer, middle, and inner structures; converts sound waves to neural signals; houses vestibular system for equilibrium.

name: Human Nose
description: A facial structure for breathing and olfaction. Contains nasal passages and olfactory receptors; filters and warms inhaled air; highly individual shape.

name: Human Mouth
description: An opening in the face for eating, breathing, and speaking. Contains teeth, tongue, and salivary glands; first stage of digestive system; primary for verbal communication.

name: Human Tongue
description: A muscular organ in the mouth essential for taste, speech, and swallowing. Covered with taste buds; highly mobile; unique print like fingerprints.

name: Human Tooth
description: A hard structure in the jaw used for chewing food. Composed of enamel, dentin, and pulp; two sets develop through life; condition reflects overall health.

name: Human Hair
description: Keratinous filaments growing from follicles in the skin. Provides thermal regulation and protection; highly variable in color and texture; culturally significant for identity.

name: Human Skin
description: The body's largest organ, covering and protecting internal structures. Multiple layers with varied functions; produces vitamin D; first line of immune defense.

name: Human Neck
description: The body region connecting head to torso. Contains cervical spine, airway, and major blood vessels; allows head rotation; vulnerable to injury.

name: Human Shoulder
description: The complex joint connecting arm to torso. Highly mobile ball-and-socket configuration; prone to injury from overuse; supports arm movement in all directions.

name: Human Arm
description: The upper limb extending from shoulder to wrist. Contains humerus, radius, and ulna bones; enables manipulation of environment; distinguishes primates.

name: Human Elbow
description: The joint connecting upper and lower arm. Hinge joint allowing flexion and extension; prone to repetitive strain injuries; protects ulnar nerve.

name: Human Wrist
description: The joint connecting forearm to hand. Complex of eight carpal bones; enables fine hand positioning; common site of repetitive strain injury.

name: Human Hand
description: The terminal part of the arm with fingers for grasping. Opposable thumb enables precision grip; 27 bones with complex musculature; primary tool for manipulation.

name: Human Finger
description: A digit of the hand used for touching and gripping. Contains three phalanges (two in thumb); unique fingerprints for identification; high density of sensory receptors.

name: Human Thumb
description: The first digit of the hand, opposable to other fingers. Enables precision grip unique to primates; essential for tool use; has two phalanges versus three.

name: Fingernail
description: A keratinous plate covering the dorsal tip of fingers. Protects fingertips and aids fine manipulation; growth reflects health status; culturally decorated.

name: Human Chest
description: The thoracic region between neck and abdomen. Contains rib cage protecting heart and lungs; site of breast tissue; expands and contracts for breathing.

name: Human Heart
description: A muscular organ pumping blood throughout the body. Four chambers with valves; beats approximately 100,000 times daily; culturally symbolic of love and courage.

name: Human Lung
description: A respiratory organ exchanging oxygen and carbon dioxide with blood. Paired spongy organs in chest cavity; contains millions of alveoli; vulnerable to airborne pathogens and pollutants.

name: Human Stomach
description: A muscular sac that chemically and mechanically breaks down food. Produces hydrochloric acid and enzymes; holds 1-1.5 liters; connects esophagus to small intestine.

name: Human Liver
description: The largest internal organ, performing over 500 metabolic functions. Detoxifies blood, produces bile, and stores glycogen; regenerates from partial removal; damaged by alcohol excess.

name: Human Kidney
description: A bean-shaped organ filtering blood and producing urine. Paired organs maintaining fluid and electrolyte balance; removes metabolic waste; vulnerable to high blood pressure damage.

name: Small Intestine
description: A long tube where most nutrient absorption occurs. Approximately 6 meters long; lined with villi increasing surface area; connects stomach to large intestine.

name: Human Spine
description: A column of 33 vertebrae supporting the body and protecting spinal cord. S-curved for shock absorption; allows upright posture; common site of pain and injury.

name: Human Rib
description: A curved bone forming the thoracic cage. Twelve pairs protecting heart and lungs; articulate with spine and sternum; can fracture from trauma.

name: Human Hip
description: The ball-and-socket joint connecting leg to pelvis. Bears body weight; enables walking and running; common site of arthritis and replacement surgery.

name: Human Leg
description: The lower limb from hip to ankle. Contains femur, tibia, and fibula; primary for locomotion; distinguishes humans as bipedal.

name: Human Knee
description: The largest joint in the body, connecting thigh to lower leg. Hinge joint with stabilizing ligaments; bears significant body weight; highly prone to injury.

name: Human Ankle
description: The joint connecting lower leg to foot. Enables plantar and dorsiflexion; commonly sprained; critical for balance and locomotion.

name: Human Foot
description: The terminal part of the leg supporting body weight. Contains 26 bones in arch structure; adapted for bipedal locomotion; size varies significantly.

name: Human Toe
description: A digit of the foot aiding balance and propulsion. Big toe essential for walking gait; often affected by footwear; prone to fungal infections.

name: Human Bone
description: A rigid organ forming the skeleton. Composed of collagen and calcium phosphate; produces blood cells in marrow; remodels throughout life.

name: Skeletal Muscle
description: Striated voluntary muscle attached to bones enabling movement. Contracts when stimulated by motor neurons; comprises approximately 40% of body weight; atrophies without use.

name: Human Blood
description: A liquid tissue circulating through vessels transporting oxygen, nutrients, and wastes. Contains red cells, white cells, platelets, and plasma; typed for transfusion compatibility.

name: Peripheral Nerve
description: A bundle of axons transmitting signals between central nervous system and body. Enables sensation and motor control; can regenerate slowly when damaged.

name: Jugular Vein
description: A major blood vessel returning deoxygenated blood from head to heart. Visible in neck when dilated; clinically significant for central line access.

name: Carotid Artery
description: A major blood vessel supplying oxygenated blood to head and brain. Pulse palpable in neck; blockage causes stroke; monitored for cardiovascular health.

name: Human Cell
description: The fundamental unit of human biological organization. Contains nucleus with genetic material; trillions form the body; diverse types with specialized functions.

name: Human DNA
description: The double-helix molecule containing genetic information in chromosomes. Approximately 3 billion base pairs; 99.9% identical between individuals; basis of inheritance and identity.

name: Human Gene
description: A segment of DNA encoding instructions for a protein or RNA molecule. Approximately 20,000 protein-coding genes; variations cause traits and diseases; subject of genetic research.

name: Human Chromosome
description: A structure of coiled DNA and protein in cell nuclei. 23 pairs in humans; carries genes; abnormalities cause conditions like Down syndrome.

name: Hemoglobin
description: The iron-containing protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen. Four subunits with heme groups; gives blood red color; mutations cause sickle cell disease.

name: Digestive Enzyme
description: A protein catalyzing the breakdown of food molecules. Includes amylase, lipase, and protease; produced by salivary glands, stomach, and pancreas; essential for nutrient absorption.

name: Human Hormone
description: A chemical messenger transported in blood to regulate body functions. Includes insulin, cortisol, and sex hormones; produced by endocrine glands; imbalances cause diverse disorders.

name: Human Antibody
description: A Y-shaped protein produced by immune cells to neutralize pathogens. Binds specifically to antigens; basis of immunity and vaccination; used therapeutically.

name: Human Tissue
description: A group of similar cells performing a specific function. Four main types: epithelial, connective, muscle, and nervous; organized into organs.

name: Human Organ
description: A structure composed of multiple tissues performing specific functions. Includes heart, liver, and brain; some occur in pairs; failure may require transplantation.

name: Sourdough Bread
description: A leavened bread made with naturally fermented starter culture. Tangy flavor from lactic and acetic acids; chewy texture with open crumb; traditional technique revived by artisan bakers.

name: Beef Steak
description: A cut of muscle tissue from cattle, typically grilled or pan-seared. High in protein and iron; graded by marbling; cooking preferences vary from rare to well-done.

name: Broccoli
description: A green vegetable with edible florets and stalks from the cabbage family. Rich in fiber, vitamin C, and sulforaphane compounds; steamed, roasted, or eaten raw; associated with health benefits.

name: Banana
description: A curved yellow fruit of tropical cultivated plants. Soft sweet flesh rich in potassium; consumed fresh or in cooking; major global commodity with narrow genetic base.

name: Whole Wheat Grain
description: The entire kernel of wheat including bran, germ, and endosperm. Higher fiber and nutrients than refined flour; used for bread and cereals; stone-ground or roller-milled.

name: Cheddar Cheese
description: A firm cow's milk cheese originating from Somerset, England. Aged from months to years; sharp flavor intensifies with age; melts well for cooking.

name: Chicken Egg
description: An ovum produced by domestic hens, consumed worldwide. Protein-rich with versatile culinary uses; shell color varies by breed; graded by size and quality.

name: Parmigiano-Reggiano
description: An aged hard cheese from specific Italian regions with protected designation. Granular texture and umami flavor; aged minimum 12 months; grated or eaten in chunks.

name: Unsalted Butter
description: A dairy product made by churning cream to separate butterfat. Yellow solid at room temperature; essential in baking and cooking; approximately 80% fat content.

name: Whole Cow's Milk
description: A white liquid produced by lactating cattle. Contains fat, protein, calcium, and vitamins; pasteurized for safety; processed into numerous dairy products.

name: Greek Yogurt
description: A strained fermented milk product with thick, creamy texture. Higher protein than regular yogurt; contains live probiotic cultures; used in cooking and eating fresh.

name: Honeycrisp Apple
description: A modern apple cultivar with crisp texture and balanced sweet-tart flavor. Developed at University of Minnesota; stores well; commands premium prices.

name: Navel Orange
description: A seedless citrus fruit with characteristic "navel" formation. Sweet flavor and easy peeling; high vitamin C content; California and Florida main producers.

name: Cavendish Banana
description: The dominant commercially grown banana variety worldwide. Seedless and yellow when ripe; threatened by Panama disease; descended from limited genetic stock.

name: Concord Grape
description: A slip-skin American grape variety with intense fruity flavor. Deep purple with natural bloom; used for juice, jelly, and wine; cold-hardy.

name: Roma Tomato
description: A plum-shaped tomato variety with meaty flesh and few seeds. Ideal for sauces and canning; bright red when ripe; determinate growth habit.

name: Russet Potato
description: A large starchy potato with rough brown skin. Ideal for baking and frying; fluffy texture when cooked; dominant variety in North American markets.

name: Nantes Carrot
description: A cylindrical orange root vegetable with sweet flavor and crisp texture. High in beta-carotene; eaten raw or cooked; stores well in cool conditions.

name: Yellow Onion
description: A pungent bulb vegetable with papery skin and layered flesh. Essential aromatic base for cooking worldwide; becomes sweet when caramelized; causes lacrimation when cut.

name: Garlic Bulb
description: A pungent bulb composed of multiple cloves. Antimicrobial properties; foundational ingredient in cuisines worldwide; odor from sulfur compounds when crushed.

name: Romaine Lettuce
description: A sturdy lettuce variety with elongated crisp leaves. Traditional Caesar salad green; relatively high nutritional content for lettuce; grows upright in heads.

name: Baby Spinach
description: Young leaves of spinach harvested early for tender texture. High in iron, calcium, and vitamins; eaten raw in salads or cooked; available year-round.

name: Broccoli Floret
description: The edible flower head portion of broccoli. Dense clusters of green buds; steamed, roasted, or stir-fried; contains glucosinolates with health benefits.

name: Bell Pepper
description: A sweet pepper cultivar with thick flesh in various colors. Crisp and mild when raw; softens when cooked; red peppers sweeter than green.

name: Black Bean
description: A small, shiny legume common in Latin American cuisines. High in protein and fiber; used in soups, tacos, and salads; long storage life when dried.

name: Raw Almond
description: The edible seed of the almond tree in tan papery skin. High in healthy fats and vitamin E; eaten whole, sliced, or processed into milk and butter.

name: Sunflower Seed
description: The edible kernel from sunflower heads. Nutty flavor and crunchy texture; source of vitamin E and selenium; eaten as snack or pressed for oil.

name: Raw Honey
description: A viscous sweet substance produced by honey bees from flower nectar. Unprocessed and unpasteurized; contains enzymes and pollen; natural antimicrobial properties.

name: Ground Cumin
description: A dried, ground spice from Cuminum cyminum seeds. Warm, earthy flavor essential to many cuisines; used in curry blends and Mexican dishes.

name: Fresh Basil
description: An aromatic herb with bright green leaves and distinctive sweet flavor. Essential to Italian cuisine; used fresh or dried; multiple cultivars with varying flavors.

name: Black Tea
description: Fully oxidized tea leaves producing a robust, dark brew. Higher caffeine than green tea; varieties include Assam, Darjeeling, and Earl Grey; world's most consumed tea type.

name: Arabica Coffee Bean
description: Seeds of Coffea arabica, the dominant specialty coffee species. Complex flavor with natural sweetness; grown at high altitudes; more expensive than Robusta.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Wine
description: A full-bodied red wine from the grape of the same name. Tannic structure suitable for aging; flavors of black currant and cedar; originated in Bordeaux.

name: India Pale Ale
description: A hoppy beer style with bitter flavor and higher alcohol content. Originally brewed strong for export to India; craft beer revival favorite; many substyles exist.

name: Fresh-Squeezed Orange Juice
description: Liquid extracted from oranges without concentration or processing. Contains vitamin C and natural sugars; best consumed fresh; commercial versions often reconstituted.

name: Chicken Noodle Soup
description: A broth-based soup with chicken pieces, vegetables, and noodles. Traditional comfort and remedy food; prepared commercially or from scratch; culturally associated with illness recovery.

name: Tomato Sauce
description: A cooked preparation of tomatoes, often with herbs and aromatics. Base for pasta dishes and pizza; varies from smooth to chunky; preserved in jars or cans.

name: Extra Virgin Olive Oil
description: Oil extracted from olives by mechanical means without chemical processing. Fruity flavor with peppery finish; monounsaturated fats considered heart-healthy; grades by acidity level.

name: Balsamic Vinegar
description: An aged vinegar originating from Modena, Italy. Dark, complex, and slightly sweet; traditional versions aged decades; used in dressings and finishing dishes.

name: All-Purpose Flour
description: Refined wheat flour with moderate protein content. Versatile for baking and cooking; bleached or unbleached versions; foundation of countless recipes.

name: Dried Spaghetti
description: Long, cylindrical pasta made from durum wheat semolina. Italian staple paired with various sauces; standardized cooking times; originated in Italy.

name: Ramen Noodle
description: A wheat noodle of Chinese origin popular in Japanese cuisine. Alkaline ingredients give distinctive yellow color and chewiness; served in broth with toppings.

name: Chocolate Layer Cake
description: A multi-layered cake with chocolate in batter and frosting. Rich, sweet celebration dessert; American classic with numerous variations; requires multiple components.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookie
description: A sweet baked treat with chocolate pieces embedded in dough. Invented in 1930s Massachusetts; crispy or chewy variations; iconic American cookie.

name: Gummy Bear
description: A small fruit-flavored gelatin candy in bear shape. Created in Germany in 1920s; multiple colors and flavors; popular children's confection.

name: Dark Chocolate Bar
description: Chocolate with high cocoa content and minimal sugar. Contains flavonoids with potential health benefits; bitter to semi-sweet flavor; minimum 70% cocoa for "dark" designation.

name: Vanilla Ice Cream
description: A frozen dairy dessert flavored with vanilla. Smooth, creamy texture from churning during freezing; world's most popular ice cream flavor; basis for many variations.

name: Neapolitan Pizza
description: A pizza style originating from Naples with thin center and puffy crust. Baked in wood-fired oven at high heat; San Marzano tomatoes and fresh mozzarella; protected traditional designation.

name: Club Sandwich
description: A multi-layered sandwich with chicken, bacon, lettuce, and tomato. Typically triple-decker with toasted bread; secured with toothpicks; American lunch staple.

name: Caesar Salad
description: A salad of romaine lettuce with creamy anchovy dressing and croutons. Created in Tijuana in 1920s; traditionally prepared tableside; often topped with grilled chicken.

name: Chef's Knife
description: A large multipurpose kitchen knife with curved blade for rocking motion. Typically 8-10 inches; used for chopping, slicing, and mincing; most essential kitchen tool.

name: Dinner Fork
description: A four-tined utensil for spearing and conveying food to mouth. Standard table setting component; evolved from two-tined medieval versions; size indicates formality level.

name: Soup Spoon
description: A round-bowled utensil designed for consuming liquid foods. Larger than teaspoon; bowl shape varies by culture; used with formal dining protocol.

name: Ceramic Dinner Plate
description: A flat, circular dish for serving individual portions of food. Typically 10-11 inches diameter; fired clay with glazed surface; standard table setting element.

name: Cereal Bowl
description: A rounded vessel for holding breakfast cereals, soups, or other foods. Deeper than soup bowl; various materials and sizes; everyday dining essential.

name: Drinking Glass
description: A cylindrical vessel without handles for consuming beverages. Transparent glass or plastic; various sizes for different drinks; part of standard table setting.

name: Stock Pot
description: A large, tall cooking vessel for making stocks, soups, and boiling pasta. Heavy-gauge metal with lid; capacities from 8 to 20+ quarts; essential for batch cooking.

name: Cast Iron Skillet
description: A heavy frying pan of molded iron requiring seasoning maintenance. Excellent heat retention and even cooking; lasts generations with care; improves with use.

name: Gas Range Oven
description: A cooking appliance combining stovetop burners with enclosed baking chamber. Natural gas or propane fuel; precise temperature control; preferred by professional cooks.

name: Induction Cooktop
description: A cooking surface using electromagnetic fields to heat ferrous cookware directly. Energy-efficient and responsive; stays cool except under pot; requires compatible cookware.

name: Refrigerator-Freezer
description: An insulated appliance maintaining cold temperatures for food preservation. Compressor-based cooling system; essential modern household appliance; various configurations and sizes.

name: Claw Hammer
description: A striking tool with metal head and curved claw for nail removal. Wooden, fiberglass, or steel handle; fundamental carpentry tool; weight varies by application.

name: Phillips Screwdriver
description: A hand tool with cruciform tip for driving Phillips-head screws. Self-centering design prevents cam-out; various sizes; named after inventor Henry Phillips.

name: Adjustable Wrench
description: A hand tool with movable jaw accommodating various bolt sizes. Also called crescent wrench; single tool replaces multiple fixed wrenches; essential home toolkit item.

name: Needle-Nose Pliers
description: A hand tool with long, tapered jaws for gripping small objects. Useful in tight spaces; often includes wire cutters; essential for electrical and jewelry work.

name: Circular Saw
description: A power tool with rotating toothed blade for cutting wood and other materials. Handheld or table-mounted versions; various blade types; requires safety precautions.

name: Cordless Drill
description: A battery-powered tool for boring holes and driving screws. Rechargeable lithium-ion batteries; variable speed and torque settings; most popular power tool category.

name: Common Nail
description: A metal fastener with flat head driven into materials with hammer. Various lengths and gauges; holds by friction and displacement; galvanized for outdoor use.

name: Wood Screw
description: A threaded fastener that cuts its own threads in wood. Tapered body and various head styles; stronger than nails for certain applications; removed and reused easily.

name: Hex Bolt
description: A threaded fastener with six-sided head for wrench tightening. Used with nuts for mechanical assemblies; various grades and materials; precise engineering component.

name: Mechanical Lever
description: A rigid bar rotating around a fulcrum to multiply force or change direction. One of six classical simple machines; enables moving heavy loads; basis of countless mechanisms.

name: Block And Tackle Pulley
description: A system of pulleys with rope for mechanical advantage in lifting. Multiplies force applied; used on ships and construction; reduces effort required to lift heavy loads.

name: Wagon Wheel
description: A circular frame with spokes rotating around an axle for reduced friction transport. Revolutionary ancient invention; enabled wheeled vehicles; basis of modern transportation.

name: Rotating Axle
description: A shaft on which wheels rotate to enable vehicle movement. Transmits rotational force; various configurations for different vehicles; essential mechanical component.

name: Mechanical Gear
description: A toothed wheel that meshes with others to transmit rotational motion. Changes speed, torque, and direction; various types for different applications; precision manufacturing required.

name: Coil Spring
description: A helical elastic device that stores mechanical energy when compressed or extended. Used in suspension, mattresses, and mechanisms; various materials and specifications.

name: Ball Bearing
description: A rolling-element machine component reducing friction between rotating parts. Steel balls between races; enables smooth rotation; essential in motors and wheels.

name: Centrifugal Pump
description: A machine using rotating impeller to move fluids through kinetic energy. Common for water supply and industrial processes; various sizes and materials; requires priming.

name: Ball Valve
description: A flow control device using rotating spherical closure element. Quarter-turn operation; tight seal; used in plumbing and industrial applications.

name: Copper Water Pipe
description: A tube of copper metal for conveying water in plumbing systems. Corrosion-resistant and long-lasting; joined by soldering or compression fittings; gradually replaced by PEX.

name: Electrical Wire
description: A conductor, typically copper, insulated with plastic for carrying electrical current. Various gauges for different loads; color-coded for function; essential for electrical systems.

name: Coaxial Cable
description: A shielded cable for transmitting high-frequency signals. Copper core surrounded by insulation and braided shield; used for cable television and internet; various grades.

name: Roller Chain
description: A series of connected links for transmitting mechanical power. Used in bicycles, motorcycles, and industrial machinery; requires lubrication; various pitch sizes.

name: Nylon Rope
description: A strong synthetic cordage made from woven nylon fibers. High strength-to-weight ratio; good elasticity and abrasion resistance; used for mooring, climbing, and general purpose.

name: Steel Hook
description: A curved metal device for catching, holding, or pulling objects. Various sizes from fishing to industrial crane hooks; load-rated for safety; simple but essential.

name: Pin Tumbler Lock
description: A cylinder lock mechanism using pins of varying lengths. Opened only by correct key profile; most common residential lock type; various security grades.

name: Metal Key
description: A cut metal device for operating a specific lock mechanism. Unique bit pattern matches internal pins or levers; easily duplicated; symbolic of access and ownership.

name: Door Hinge
description: A pivoting joint connecting door to frame and enabling swinging motion. Various materials and finishes; interior and exterior types; measured by size and weight capacity.

name: Door Handle
description: A mechanism for unlatching and opening doors. Lever or knob types; various finishes and security levels; required to meet accessibility standards.

name: Control Knob
description: A rotating interface element for adjusting settings on devices. Used on appliances, electronics, and machinery; tactile feedback important for usability.

name: Push Button
description: A mechanical switch activated by pressing to make or break an electrical circuit. Momentary or latching types; various sizes and colors; ubiquitous interface element.

name: Toggle Switch
description: An electrical switch operated by moving a lever between positions. Provides positive on-off indication; used in appliances and vehicles; various current ratings.

name: Rotary Dial
description: A circular interface element for selecting values by rotation. Used on older telephones, safes, and equipment; tactile detents for precision; largely replaced by digital interfaces.

name: Analog Meter
description: A measuring instrument displaying values on a graduated scale with moving needle. Provides continuous visual feedback; includes voltmeters, ammeters, and pressure gauges.

name: Pressure Gauge
description: An instrument measuring fluid or gas pressure in systems. Dial or digital display; various ranges and units; essential for HVAC, automotive, and industrial applications.

name: Spring Scale
description: A measuring device determining weight by spring deflection. Simple mechanical operation; various capacities; used in fishing, cooking, and laboratory applications.

name: Mercury Thermometer
description: A temperature measuring device using thermal expansion of mercury in glass tube. Accurate and reliable; being phased out due to mercury toxicity; replaced by digital versions.

name: Magnetic Compass
description: A navigation instrument using magnetized needle to indicate magnetic north. Essential for navigation before GPS; still used as backup; affected by local magnetic anomalies.

name: Mechanical Clock
description: A timekeeping device using escapement mechanism and oscillating regulator. Spring or weight driven; historical engineering achievement; largely decorative today.

name: Digital Wristwatch
description: A portable timekeeping device worn on wrist with electronic display. Quartz crystal oscillator for accuracy; various features and styles; largely replaced by smartphones.

name: Single-Family House
description: A detached residential dwelling designed for one household. Various architectural styles and sizes; typically owner-occupied; includes yard and private amenities.

name: High-Rise Building
description: A tall structure typically exceeding 75 feet with multiple floors. Steel or concrete frame construction; requires elevators; concentrates population in urban areas.

name: Observation Tower
description: A tall structure designed primarily for viewing surroundings. Various construction types; tourist attractions and fire lookouts; often architecturally distinctive.

name: Suspension Bridge
description: A bridge with deck hung from cables suspended between towers. Enables long spans over water or valleys; flexible under wind and seismic loads; iconic engineering achievements.

name: Paved Road
description: A prepared surface for vehicular travel covered with asphalt or concrete. Marked with lanes and signs; maintained by government agencies; enables modern transportation.

name: Hiking Trail
description: A cleared route through natural terrain for foot travel. Various difficulty levels; marked and maintained; provides access to wilderness recreation.

name: Brick Wall
description: A vertical structure of stacked masonry units bonded with mortar. Load-bearing or decorative; various bond patterns; traditional construction method.

name: Chain-Link Fence
description: A woven wire barrier for security and boundary definition. Galvanized or vinyl-coated steel; relatively inexpensive; used residential, commercial, and industrial.

name: Security Gate
description: A controlled access point in a fence or wall. Manual or automated operation; various security levels; controls entry to properties and facilities.

name: Exterior Door
description: A portal providing entry through building envelope. Weather-sealed and secure; various materials and styles; required emergency egress in buildings.

name: Double-Hung Window
description: A window with two vertically sliding sashes. Traditional American style; both sashes operative; easy cleaning from interior.

name: Pitched Roof
description: A roof structure with sloped surfaces shedding water and snow. Various angles and configurations; covered with shingles, tiles, or metal; most common in temperate climates.

name: Concrete Floor
description: A horizontal surface of poured and cured concrete. Strong and durable; may be polished or covered; standard for basements and commercial buildings.

name: Suspended Ceiling
description: A secondary ceiling hung below structural ceiling. Conceals utilities and improves acoustics; replaceable tiles; common in commercial interiors.

name: Spiral Staircase
description: A staircase with steps arranged around a central column. Space-efficient design; dramatic visual element; various materials and styles.

name: Passenger Elevator
description: A platform or cabin moving vertically to transport people between floors. Electric traction or hydraulic systems; essential for tall buildings; subject to safety codes.

name: Living Room
description: A room in a residence for general social activities and relaxation. Typically largest room; contains seating and entertainment; center of domestic life.

name: Entrance Hallway
description: A corridor connecting building entrance to interior rooms. Provides transition space; may include closets and seating; first impression of interior.

name: Residential Kitchen
description: A room equipped for food storage, preparation, and cooking. Contains appliances, cabinets, and work surfaces; social center in modern homes; various layout configurations.

name: Full Bathroom
description: A room containing toilet, sink, and bathing facility. Private hygiene space; plumbing and ventilation requirements; various sizes and appointments.

name: Master Bedroom
description: The primary sleeping room in a residence, typically largest. Often includes en suite bathroom and closet; private retreat; various furniture configurations.

name: Corporate Office
description: A room or space equipped for administrative and professional work. Contains desks, computers, and communication equipment; various configurations from private to open plan.

name: Manufacturing Factory
description: A building housing industrial production of goods. Contains machinery and assembly lines; zoned industrial; subject to environmental and safety regulations.

name: Storage Warehouse
description: A large building for storing goods before distribution. High ceilings and loading docks; minimal climate control; logistics hub in supply chains.

name: Retail Store
description: A commercial establishment selling goods directly to consumers. Display and checkout areas; various sizes from boutique to big box; online competition increasing.

name: Commercial Restaurant
description: An establishment preparing and serving food to paying customers. Kitchen, dining room, and service areas; various cuisines and service styles; subject to health regulations.

name: Boutique Hotel
description: A lodging establishment providing temporary paid accommodation with distinctive character. Rooms and common areas; various service levels; smaller and more personalized than chains.

name: General Hospital
description: A healthcare facility providing diagnosis and treatment of illness and injury. Emergency, inpatient, and outpatient services; complex building systems; 24-hour operation.

name: Public Elementary School
description: An educational institution for children typically ages 5-11. Classrooms, cafeteria, and play areas; government-funded and operated; foundational education.

name: Christian Church
description: A building for Christian religious worship and community activities. Sanctuary, offices, and meeting spaces; various architectural traditions; community gathering place.
